name: Porth Neigwl (Hell's Mouth)
description: 4-mile beach facing full Atlantic. Can get massive. Strong rips and currents. Remote location - no facilities. For experienced surfers only.

name: Abersoch
description: Sheltered town beach. Small waves suit beginners and SUPs. Popular holiday destination so busy in summer. Works on south swells.

name: Porth Ceiriad
access_notes: Limited parking at the top of the cliffs. Arrive early.
description: A beautiful cove known for its clean, powerful waves breaking over a reef. It's a shorter wave than Hell's Mouth, but often more hollow. Best at mid to high tide.

name: Porth Oer (Whistling Sands)
access_notes: National Trust car park walk 5 mins
description: Famous squeaky sand. North-facing so works on different swells. Sheltered and scenic. Good for beginners on small days.

name: Criccieth
description: Beach below the castle. Needs big swell to wrap in or strong southerly windswell.

name: Rhosneigr
description: Anglesey's surf hub. Consistent beach break with mellow vibe. Kitesurfers share the beach. Good facilities and village atmosphere.

name: Cable Bay (Porth Trecastell)
access_notes: Small car park at Cable Bay (LL65 2NJ).
description: Small, beautiful crescent of sand between low headlands. Can produce decent waves on its day. Can get crowded.

name: Aberffraw
description: Where locals go when tourists descend on Newborough. Wildflowers, birdlife, no facilities. Proper escape.

name: Traeth Llydan (Broad Beach)
description: Just south of Rhosneigr, Broad Beach offers similar conditions, but often with fewer crowds.

name: Newborough Beach (Llanddwyn)
description: Vast beach with views to Snowdonia. Llanddwyn Island at south end is magical. Romantic legend and lighthouse ruins. Allow whole day.
